page.title: 02General Sea View Silverdale
page.content: More than half the area is tidal with salt marshes and deep channels. The largest of these is that of the river Kent which flows close to the coastline. This channel changes course and in recent years has been moving gradually from the Grange-over-Sands side of the estuary towards the Silverdale shore.Local folklore maintains that this happens once in a lifetime, and certainly this is being borne out at the present time. The tide may vary during the year from a neap of about 7 metres to a spring of more than 10 metres. When the tide is low one can see the embankment made over 100 years ago extending seawards for half a mile from Jenny Brown's Point using stone from the disused quarry. The salt marshes are rich feeding grounds for a large number of seabirds
